Reviews.Title: “Clean but horrible location”
Reviews.Author: Panterina-NYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights during New Years Eve. The hotel overall was so and so... Nothing special to write about. However, the location is terrible. The bus stop that takes you to "Roma Termini" (The main train station in Rome) is about a 10 minute walk and arrives every 30 minutes. The bus ride alone is about 15-20 minutes depending on the traffic. The hotel room is VERY NOISY! You can hear everything from the elevator, to people walking in the hallways with their bags and the people in the room next to you having a normal conversation. The size of the room was average. The bed was also a pretty descent size considering that my boyfriend is 6 ft 7 (2 meters) tall. I will also add that the hotel and room was very clean and the decor wasn't so bad. Modern but not chic. The staff at the front desk were not so friendly & charged the wrong credit card at the end of our stay. We will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Ars-mazing”
Reviews.Author: EmilyandDan09
Reviews.Content: I really cannot understand the bad reviews for this hotel. I had read them before I visited and stayed at the Ars Hotel and so I was a little worried and concerned. I needn't have been. From the moment we arrived the staff could not do enough for us. They were also extremely helpful when we were asking advice on how to get to and from the different areas of Rome to either visit the monuments or to recommend a good place for us to eat. This was my second time in Rome and the trip was a birthday present from my boyfriend. My boyfriend had made requests via email that we had a Jacuzzi bath in our room as a treat for me, and this had been arranged for our arrival. The breakfast it a traditional European Breakfast with the bread, toast, jam, cereal, yoghurt, ham, cheese, eggs and the delicious cake that you only ever get severed for breakfast whilst in Europe. As a well as teas, juices and and coffees. The hotel is a little way out of central Rome but it is very easy to find your way into the city, especially with the staff being as helpful as they were. They also provided us with maps to help you get around the city and would detail down our route and the bus numbers that we needed. I quite enjoyed being a little out of the city as I felt that I experienced and saw how the some of the Italian’s lived. There is also a traditional deli close to the hotel on the main road and an ice-cream parlour selling pastries and cakes as well. Drinks, ice-cream and pastries were also cheaper further out of the city. I decided to write this review after reading all of the other bad reviews regarding this hotel. It really was a lovely hotel with friendly and approachable staff. I would definitely stay here again on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Appauling welcome, but otherwise OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkHaff
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome for a 3 day break and this hotel was advertised as being fairly cheap and within easy reach of the city centre. You need to get a bus which takes about 30 minutes which was OK, but in hindsight it would be have been better to stay closer. The most notable part of our stay was our welcome. We had requested via the hotel for a taxi to meet us at the airport, but on arrival there was no sign of the driver. We managed to ask someone and they packed us off to a taxi. It turned out this was not the hotel's taxi (they'd sent it to the wrong airport) and cost me a lot of money. On arrival at the hotel, we received a barrage of abuse from the staff member that really made me think twice about staying there. Unfortunately they did very little to make up for this during our stay. Otherwise, the rooms are OK, the general location of the hotel isnt great (in a bit of a dingy back street) but Rome is great and if you just want someone to lay for the night with a decent breakfast, this fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Four Stars worth one”
Reviews.Author: AGADOTTI
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel and checked in in a room we liked. Later we discovered that the staff moved our thing to a much worse room without a desk. After complaining the staff sent us wandering around in search of a room with a desk. It seems they did not know which room has what. Finally found one. The next day we arrived late at night and our bed was without a blanket or douvet. We called and first they sent us a single blanket not enough to cover the bed. Called again and they claimed they run out of douvet ... where was the one we used the night before ?? finally after insisting on the phone the douvet arrived and we had to make the bed by ourselves. Incredible. Service is of a 1 star hotel, facilities and room can be rated TOP at 3 star. 4 stars are overrrated.

Reviews.Title: “ARS staff comes honestly by it's name”
Reviews.Author: msr63
Reviews.Content: We haven't checked out and I am writing this before we leave. While the facility is reasonable the customer service is atrocious. Internet in the room didn't work since the day we checked in. "Wireless" internet was allegedly available but never worked and we were told "it's those American computers." Not once was an offer made to find a solution or resolve the problem. We had no way to reach friends and family. Customer service throughout the stay was deplorable and got worse the longer our stay lasted. The topper when we were "fined" for an alleged wine stain on the bedding. We were told we were to not drink the in the room and we had carried our wine glasses right by the managers on the way to our room, having purchased the wine at the hotel bar, bad wine at that, and nothing was said. The fine equaled almost one night's stay and ironic that a hotel uses bedding that cannot be easily laundered for a resonable rate. There are plenty of nice places to stay in Rome. Make sure you find one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Very far from a 4 star level. If you get a really good deal, go for it, it's a decent accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: SCrCologne
Reviews.Content: Pretty far away from city center. Bus connection is good, but will take you at least half an hour to get there (plus some waiting time), and buses are often very crowded, so pretty uncomfortable if you are with luggage. Room had a very inefficient design, no desk, a water kettle that could only be plugged into the same power outlet of the fridge, not even a shelf in the shower to put your soap bottles, dirty and worn out shades. The worst: big windows (with pretty dismal view) and no way to block light. Only transparent white shades. How is someone expected to sleep this way? The design of the hotel makes it cumbersome to move, expecially when you arrive with your luggage. You have to go up and down several flights of stairs, as some rooms are in an adjacent building. Breakfast is bad: little on offer, not very good. Only one staff, who was way too little. Had to wait for plates because the were being washed. Would not recommend this place, unless you are on a tight budget and you find a very good offer. In that case, I guess it's acceptable. Considering it a 4 star is a pretty good joke.

Reviews.Title: “But the night!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: masterjoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed last week and I had a good impression of the hotel. Very well located and peaceful, well connected with the center of Rome, very clean environment with a particular design and comfortable rooms, . But I had only a problem in the night with the night concierge. He was very unhelpful as he didn't speak English other staff was very kind and smiling.

Reviews.Title: “Just awful! Staff attitude shocking. No management. Dont go.”
Reviews.Author: PDM44
Reviews.Content: I will keep it brief as i could rant for ever. A mixture of inept staff, insubordinate staff and one nice female member. No management in evidence or contactable. Small rooms. 5 star is a joke. On top of that its 30 min bus ride to centre. Hated it. Dirty blinds, broken plastic cups for coffee in room. Only water and coke in minbar. The insubordinate member of staff would not let us have a kettle and just laughed when i wanted to contact management. For identification purposes he was working on the 6 November. There are no rooms with balconies which was a condition of our booking so that was a blatant misrepresentation in the advertising. TV was not tuned and blurred. Next door to a very iffy property indicating dogs and guns were inside - syringes in the street. Go somewhere else please. I have ticked incredible staff - and not in a good way!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: bulkam
Reviews.Content: We stay in Ars hotel last week for 5 nights and were fairly satisfied. The staff was very friendly and helpful (only breakfast lady can be quite moody but still helpful), breakfast acceptable but repetitive (continental breakfast with scrambled egg and bacon, fresh pastry and rolls, sliced meat and cheese, cereals, cakes and fruit) and hotel over all very clean and modern. Situated in quiet location easily accessible from city centre by public transport (20 minutes from Termini station). The only downside was the room. Even though it was clean and quite modern the size was very disappointing and the bathroom very very tiny with shower cubical so small that you can hardly turn around. We didn’t spend that much time in the room (we used it only to get some sleep after spending all day in the city) and it served its purpose. So if you planning to spent all day in Rome, do not hesitate to book this hotel. If you planning to hang around, I wouldn’t recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money - and the travel”
Reviews.Author: Graham_In_Brisvegas
Reviews.Content: We (My wife & I, and my adult son) stayed at the Ars for three nights in September 2010, and were quite satisfied with it. It's comfortable, clean, has free broadband, and had an adequate breakfast included in the tarriff. That's not to say that it is perfect, but I'd certainly recommend it to friends. Pros - Friendly staff - and 24 hour concierge, Broadband - although no WiFi - only cable, and a free-for-patrons PC in the lobby Reasonable breakfast (and great coffee!) Quiet location Cons - It is a 25 minute busride from the Termini (although I enjoyed the daily ride) No food other than Breakfast (they will order in - but you'dbe beter to eat at one of the local trattorias anyway) Overall, I'd give it 3.5 out of 5, and would probably stay again next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martaandsilvia
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights there and overall we were happy with the hotel. Yes, it's not in the middle of the city centre but we actually liked that, the location is quiet, away from the crowed streets and the traffic plus the distance was reflected in the price. There is an express bus which stops just a few steps away and takes you to Termini station in about 15 minutes (a bit longer during the rush hours but no more than 30 min). The bus is frequent and very reliable. The hotel was very clean, the staff were polite and helpful. We really liked the deco too, very modern and light, new furniture, good quality bedding There are computers in the lounge which the guests can use (very helpful with printing boading cards, googling info etc), breakfast was plentiful and there was always plenty of room in the dining room (no fighting for a table) The hotel does not have a restaurant but they have a small caffee where you can have a drink or order pizza. Our only moan was the lack of a kettle in the room which had been suggested on the website. Overall 4 out of 5 with an extra point for the cleanliness

Reviews.Title: “Don't book it!!”
Reviews.Author: Susbox
Reviews.Content: This hotel was at least a 30 minute bus trip from Termini rail way station and is in a residential area away from anything of interest. The man at the front desk was very unhelpful and rude. Do not believe them that they offer a shuttle service to the city centre as reported on their website because they don't. Also the breakfast was pretty poor with hardly any selection (and what was on offer wasn't worth eating) and also a cranky service lady.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, Quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: theexplorer25
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here for our honeymoon and although it's a little way out from the centre, we really liked the hotel. The staff were very accomodating (esp Mario and Yuri), and we thoroughly enjoyed having a pina colada on their rooftop terrace patio. It's easy enough to get to the centre, the 90 bus round the corner takes you to Termini in 20 mins and the 60 takes you to the colesseum in 30 mins. There are a couple of nice restaurants within walking distance, loved Cucura Macara, a Mexican restaurant with the best Margharitas we have ever had! This hotel is for those travellers out there who don't mind mixing with the locals and infact see it as part of the cultural experience. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “OK HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: IrelandDuchess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the ARS Hotel in feburary 2010 . We had a good size room , the furniture is totally outdated and a few pictures would help . The area is very nice and quiet ,very good resturants nearby and the 90 bus brings you into Termini.Really enjoyed our trip to Rome .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: rebeccajones1976
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in the Ars Hotel, despite the slightly comical name! Yes it is about 30 minutes bus ride from the centre of Rome, but the price was reflected in this and we enjoyed having the peace and quiet at night that we would never have had if we had stayed in the city centre. The room was simple and clean, the decor of the hotel was very modern and felt light and airy. The reception staff were very helpful. the only downside to the stay was the room service we ordered one night, possibly the worse food we have ever had! i think they order it in from a local fast food outlet and it's cold and rubbery by the time it gets to you! other than that I would definately recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ARS Hotel Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Hannsg01
Reviews.Content: The only thing missing from this Hotel was the "e" in the name....overall quite poor. Location is terrible with a 30 minute bus run into the City Centre. The bedroom we stayed in was very poor and very unlike the web site.....in fact the rooms were nothinglike the web site so I actually wonder if the pitcures were taken in the hotel at all!. The beds were very uncomfortable and the duvet was the size for a single bed.... no hot water on the first day at all so 2 cold showers! the breakfast buffet again was poor and more could have been done with little imagination. Staff were reasonably helpful however I got the feeling they were oblivious to the standards they were working in. I am sure once checked in many more people will share the same dissapointment. overall poor and I would not recomend visiting this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem - Best Buy”
Reviews.Author: MomfromMemphis
Reviews.Content: The ARS hotel is a true hidden gem. It was on a hill. It was spacious, modern and the staff was very gracious; not overly friendly, but I suspect that is because of our languaage barrier. The rooms were nice and cozy, the king-size bed was comfortable, the room clean and the large open shutter windows (which took up most of one wall) stayed open every night of our stay. The hotel is the best value for your money because of its location. It is right outside of city centre and right up the hill from a great bus station. Everyone travels by bus in Rome so it was a very comfortable experience. They make it very navigatible. With a week-long bus pass and a great map we were able to visit all of the sights ourselves and never once got lost. We always got off at the same location: Monument of Vittorio Emanuele II (or what is known as the Typewriter or Wedding cake). It was centrally located and we were able to walk to the Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Coloseum, Museums and local shops and diners. The hotel is also within walking distance to several restaurants, pizzerias, a pharmacy, a local grocery store/pastry shop (where we stopped everynight for the best pastries), open-air market with fresh flowers, fruits and vegetables and the weekend had a great crafts fair where I bought all my souveniers. If you have mobility issues - this is NOT the hotel for you. My husband and I are not active people and we were out of breath by the time we reached the top of the hill (our hotel); however, we would not let that stop us from booking with them again. It really was a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, terrible beds though”
Reviews.Author: Ingkam
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a short business trip to Rome. The hotel is located in a quiet side street, with hardly any traffic. As soon as you get close to the hotel it's quit good signposted (for Italian standards). The offer free parking on the hotel grounds, be prepared though to leave your car key in the reception as it's narrow space and sometimes they need to move cars around to give everybody access to the parking. The hotel staff is friendly and helpfull, especially the night manager is very nice. All of them speak English. The rooms are standard, the beds are hard and there is no pillow menu (which I think everyhotel should have). Free internet access available, both in the lobby as on your room. No wireless, you need to get a cable from the reception. My room had a step in the halway and off course I tripped over it and squeezed my enkel, which a set back for my whole trip. There is A/C in the room, though adjusting it is a bit of gamble. You can open the windows (which have blinds in front of them) and overlook the garden (and the parked cars). Some rooms are in the basement, make sure to avoid these. If you sleep with the window open, you will experience Roman traffic sounds throughout the nigth Breakfast was reasonably OK, limited but with fresh bread, cake and cappucino up to Italian standards. Beautifull breakfast room with nice furniture and glass facade, but even nicer ... walk out of the breakfast room and turn left through the emergency exit, where there is a nice little garden to sit in! Although the hotel offers a short menu off warm meals I found that it was impossible to order them late on the evening (which is basically the moment you don't want to go out for a meal anymore). Within 200-500 metres from the hotel there is a good choice of restaurants, ask the reception! The hotel offers a 50 euro shuttle taxi to the airport which is recommendable (at least you sit in a comfy car and not in a crappy fiat punto, it's still a lot of money though) Because we were on business trip we had to use cars to drive around the Roman area, which is definately not recommandable and only managable for really experienced European drivers!! In any other event, use public transport or taxis. Traffic is pure horror!

Reviews.Title: “Comme ci, comme blah...”
Reviews.Author: Mammachula
Reviews.Content: There are a few things this place needs to work on. First of all the woman who greeted us was practically contemptuous of the guests she encountered. (Graziella). She should get out of the tourism industry completely. She is not doing the hotel a favor. Overall most of the people who worked at this hotel seemed like they would rather stab their eyes out than be of any service to any of their guests. Nary a smile or helpful attitude. I'm sorry, but I don't speak italian, and maybe if I did they would have been a tad warmer, but I doubt it. HINT: Don't be tempted to check in early, either, as you will be assigned a room in the dungeon next to the housekeeping office. Did they bother to tell us when I checked in that the toilet was not flushing and that there was no running water? NO! I had to call them and when I asked about it, again, an insulting tone of voice. They really should have told us when we checked in....but that would have been too easy. The location is a pain to get to and the neighborhood is somewhat sketchy. Of course street signs in Rome make it almost impossible to find by car or on foot (from the bus). Even though you might get a better rate staying here, you will spend that money on a cab getting there or going to Termini or elsewhere in Rome...especially if you have a cab driver (one of the official ones mind you) that charged me 30 Euros and an additional 2 for the bags. Ha! I only gave him 20 so he was not so happy about that, but after I found out that my partner took a cab from the same location and was only charged 12 Euro I felt justified. Okay, back to the hotel....they are simply adequate. The breakfast was good though and they will make you delicious cappucino for breakfast. The breakfast dude didn't look happy either. When you work in a hotel where there are very many tourists coming from all over the world, kind words and a smile are appreciated. When we asked for directions the gentleman at the desk wrote all over a map (and by this I mean he wrote over the street names so we couldn't read them!). A suggestion would be that they print out directions in English, French and Italian, as a supplement to their directions. They should also have directions printed out to get to the airport and Termini by bus and car, along with the general going rate for taxi service to the top spots in town. By the way, they do have internet service in the lobby, but the printer did not work...a simple sing written in English and ITalian stating that the printer is broken and that if you need to print something out, email it to the hotel and they will print it for you would have been better than stressing out thinking that you might not be able to print your boarding pass. They don't go any extra mile whatsoever. This place did not cut the mustard and I do not recommend it unless there is no where else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Contemporary Hotel away from the busy city scene”
Reviews.Author: doodlist
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet safe neighborhood about 30mins away from the city centre by bus. It has a homey and warm Mediterranean feel outside, but in contrast the interiors is minimalist and modern and has an almost sterile feel. The room we got was spacious as well as the bathroom. The ceiling is quite high and gives the room and extra spacious feel, but the downside is that the air-condition had some difficulty in fully cooling off the room (but still a comfortable temperature) It was very clean and they had also conveniently internet connection in the room and you can also use the computers in the lobby for free. The breakfast was good, but they don’t' serve dinner. There are some restaurants near the area, but nothing very fancy. The terrace area was also very relaxing. The staff was nice and accommodating, but there were few staff working there. We stayed there in August and got a nice price so I would say it was very good value for money and would definitely recommend this hotel for couples, adults or business travelers who don't mind to stay a bit away from the city centre. If you are traveling with small kids it might be a challenge especially if you have a pram because the public transportation is not pram friendly. But overall it was a relaxing and comfortable stay (the way a vacation should be) and it gets full points for cleanliness! I will surely want to stay there again as soon as my son is older because Rome is more of a city for adults to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: oakwood416
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 1st july to 6th good clean hotel.Breakfast plenty of,rooms ok would definately use again

Reviews.Title: “could be better”
Reviews.Author: peachpitts
Reviews.Content: We were very disspointed in this stay at the hotel. It was meant to be a special trip for an anniversary. The hotel said they would make the trip memorable for us. It was memorable, but not in a positve sense. The °triple° room that they assigned us was so small, it was just a double with a roll away added. It could be called a triple. I asked to be changed to another room, but the only one available was in the basement. I booked the hotel in March to be sure of getting a nice room and even mentioned in my reservation that I would like a large room like we had in the past. I wouldnt stay again unless they would guarantee a large room not next to the elevator that went all night long. also if you want to see Rome, it is a little far away especially during a hot, humid summer. I would stay closer to the center of Rome and not have to go through the 1/2 hour bus ride each way on a crowded, hot bus.

Reviews.Title: “A little out of town - perfect if you are driving to Rome”
Reviews.Author: skippy82
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 2 nights in July 2009. We drove to Rome from Tuscany and were able to locate the hotel quite easily. We were fortunate to find a car park on the street outside the hotel for free but I believe you can park securely on the grounds for $10 per day. Like the other reviewers we caught the bus into Rome and didn't have any issues. The bus runs every 10 minutes and costs $1. The rooms were quite modern and included WiFi. There are two free computers in the lobby with high speed Internet. They even have a free printer which we made use of. The safe in the room costs $5 for your stay - which I found strange. The breakfast was nice with ample selection. If you are driving to Rome, consider this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Easy To Travel To City Centre”
Reviews.Author: ryany2027
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed for a long weekend. The hotel was really nice, the rooms were kept clean, and the staff were very easy. A bus stop is located near by (the '90' into Rome city centre). We didnt pay for a bus journey all weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, helpful staff, quiet a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: mav09Delran
Reviews.Content: I found the ARS to be a great little Hotel. We were treated very well, the staff went out of their way more than once for me. Clean and modern with roomy accomodations. Jacuzzi, stall shower, bidet in a very large bathroom. Extremely clean with marble everywhere. A great place if you want to relax at your hotel for a day besides your sightseeing agenda. Private courtyard, roof top lounge-really nice view, very private setting off the main drag. Although a bit out of the city center. the bus gets you downtown or take a cab back for 15 euro afterhours. Really enjoyed our time there.

Reviews.Title: “Second time here--splendid, just like the first time.”
Reviews.Author: Pacdan
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at the ARS Hotel. As before, the room was clean and comfortable, the breakfast wonderful, and the staff very helpful and attentive. Realize that the ARS is not in the middle of Rome, but rather an express bus ride away from the Roma Termini. Get the Roma Pass from the Tourist office and all becomes easy. It does add a bit of time to the end of the day, however. There are number of good restaurants near the hotel, which is on a quiet residential street. That means that the hotel is quiet, an advantage over hotels more in Rome's central tourist area. The people in the neighborhood are nice and helpful, like the hotel staff. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Uk321
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff friendly, and happy to provide information or arrange a taxi. The breakfast was well stocked and plentiful, and there was a small tea tray in the room. There was also a small bar and a mini bar in the room. The bus stop is about a 5 mins walk from the hotel and reception provided information on routes into the city. Bus number 60 will take you to the Colosseum, Roman Forum and near to the train station. If you change in the city to the number 40 bus, this will take you to the Vatican and near to the Trevi Fountain. The hotel is in the suburbs so expect it to take between 20 - 30 mins on the bus to reach the centre, the buses were very busy and standing is the norm. On the plus side the buses were cheap 1 Euro for 75 mins travel. Nearby there were good resturants (ask at reception for a card and you will get a discount at a nearby resturant). There was also a couple of small shops nearby. When we booked we understood there was a free bus shuttle to the city centre but this was not available so we used public transport.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Molly050
Reviews.Content: Mario D the recptionist was very helpfull and very friendly.The hotel is a bit far from the city but it didnt put us off as the hotel is really nice and the rooms are really bright and airy,as city hotels go our room was a treat and very big,we go on a lot of city breaks and i have to say thats its the nicest hotel we stayed in.thers a lovely restaurant just down the road from the hotel and really cheap and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel, WAY too far outside the city.”
Reviews.Author: faithc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to this hotel on our honeymoon in November 2008. The hotel itself is lovely, and the nicest in terms of amenities and comfort (of the four cities we stayed in – Milan, Venice, Florence, and Rome.) Breakfast was not bad, and the hotel itself was very clean. There is free Internet access in the lobby. The staff was not very friendly or helpful though. One thing to note. This hotel truly is far outside of the city. It is about a 25-30 minute bus drive into the main train/bus station (Termini.) Sometimes, we had to wait for the bus for quite a while. The neighborhood is safe, although at night, I felt a bit out of place. The bus that takes you into and out of the city is very, very crowded all the time. Given the chance, I might stay here again, just because hotels like this near the city center would cost five times as much. But, if you don’t have much time in Rome, the long commute isn’t worth it. Also, one place to try foodwise…Obika Mozzarella Bar. It was amazing!!! Especially the straciatella mozzarella. This is in Rome proper.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: DLLOYD8
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner have just returned from our stay in this hotel. We arrived on Friday 27th February to a very helpful lady who advised our room was not quite ready as we were early but we were more than welcome to stay and wait, however around 10 minutes later the room was ready so didn’t wait long at all. The room itself was nice, big bed and bathroom quite clean. Unfortunately there was a terrible smell in the room which would not go, possibly the smell of stale cigarettes even though we did request a non smoking room. After un-packing we decided we would go out and asked the lady on reception the best way to get into the centre, she was extremely helpful and got out a map and put on all the routes to all the major attractions which was really good. When returning to the hotel in the evening there was a younger man on the desk that was also very nice and helpful, they both made us feel very welcome. Breakfast was continental, there was plenty to choose from and it was stocked up regularly so this was impressive. Until leaving the hotel our stay was fine, however when it came to checking out at 6:20am our stay was ruined. We had extras to pay on our bill which we knew about, a couple of drinks and 5 EUROS for using the safe which totalled 20.50, however the older gentleman on the desk informed us we had 50EUROS to pay which was obviously incorrect. He then proceeded to tell us that this was for the mini-bar which we did not use, which I tried to explain to him and that I was not paying for this. By this point I was getting quite frustrated by how rude he was being, he then continued to shout in Italian at me, he could have been saying anything for all I know! After trying to make a number of phone calls and not being able to talk to anyone he accepted the 20.50 I had put on the desk by just saying “Thank-you & Bye” in general a very rude man, who spoilt the visit completely by accusing us incorrectly of using the mini bar. I will also be forwarding a letter of complaint to the hotel about the way I was spoken to as it was not acceptable. If you do decide to stay at this hotel, make sure you check the mini bar is not empty when you arrive!!!

Reviews.Title: “In our opion, not a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChasNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly and helpful, the hotel and rooms are very clean and the staff should be congratulated on that, but in our opinion this is NOT a 4* hotel having stayed in some throughout the world. It lacks the creature comforms of a 4* hotel nomatter whether it is modern in looks or not. It is in quiet location but in a built up area, not what it looks like in the web photo. Close by (300m) Busus/Tram do run very frequent all day in and out to Termini, very useful. The room was let down with plastic moulded chairs, disposible cups for tea/coffee/drinks and having to constantly ask for condements like tea/coffee for the room. Four Euro to have room service each time. Bar area is very small with no atmosphere what so ever. Again the breakfast room has plastic moulded chairs. The only lunch or evening meal available is organised by the reception staff which is frozen microwaved food or a carryout. These issues are not staff problems but management problems. A great pitty as alot could be achieved here.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: paulkeeter
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a quiet residential area just outside of the centre of Rome. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, there was a free shuttle into town each day (needs booking at the desk day before) Breakfast is plentiful, typical for europe and quite adequate Free internet, a clean spacious room ,fresh bedlinen every day, and all for a lot less than the cost of something in the city centre. There is a very frequent bus service into town which is cramped but not unpleasant (this is just the Roman way of life) Locally there are some good restaurants with a real Italian menu but not at tourist prices. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jatins
Reviews.Content: 1) This Hotel is just perfect to travel from the Roma Termini Station by Bus No.36 & 90. 90 is better bus as it takes fewer halts. From the Sempioni Bus Stop, Hotel is 7 Mins Walk. 2) No.36, 60 & 90 takes you to the City Center, Colosseum, Vatican Centre (Check for Exact Bus Routes with reception) 3) Reception Staff - I frankly did not like them. Their attitude was very very bad. But does not matter to me. 4) Breakfast was European and I prefer American. So I did not like it 5) 24x7 Computer & Internet Available 6) Lot of Grocery Shops around to pick up your own food (All close by 6 pm) 7) Rooms excellent. Bathroom excellent 8) Staff was good and helpful 9) Reception was helpful to plan our day trips

Reviews.Title: “far from the maddening crowd”
Reviews.Author: susiewoo17
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel, probably 3*. The room we had was spacious enough, plenty of room to manoevre and was very clean. The staff were friendly and the breakfast was adequate, continental style and always a seat in the breakfast room. Noise does travel though due to the hard wood floors. It wasn't so intrusive that we couldn't sleep, but you could definitely hear doors banging, people walking about and we could hear the shower going in the room above us. Our main concern was its location. It probably wasn't that far from the centre but the trafic was appalling, so on average it took 25-30 mins to get in to town and on some days as long as 40 mins and the buses are often jam packed, so it wasn't a pleasant journey. However, a day pass only costs 4 euros and is good for the whole day buses and metro (buy a ticket in the shop at the bottom of the street). We got to the hotel by bus also. We bought a coach ticket from a booth in the airport (8 euros) which took us to Termini and then a bus (no.90) from termini to Sempione (1 euro). From the bus stop walk up the hill on the left, only a few mins walk, though its not that well signposted as others had suggested. It was dark when we arrived, but we felt safe. All in all its not a bad hotel, but not close enough to the centre for us.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: angishor
Reviews.Content: We came to Ars because a friend had recomanded it to us, but we were disapoitned about the quality of the rooms and the staff. The rooms were very small and we had no place to put aur clothes, and the staff was unfriendly and unhelpful. On the other hand, the breakfast was very good and the rooms were clean. But we won't stay there again!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: laszlolizs
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through our travel agent, so we didn't know anything about it, until arrivel. We wanted a hotel with a more rustic design, so we wasn't so excited for the modern looking room at first. But here is a wonderful staff, and they certainly did everything to make our stay as comfortable as can get. In a day we truly learned to like our room as it was, a modern and comfortable room, equipped with everything you may need, nice and clean. The painting on the wall was by Joan Miro, and furniture tried to imitate the same style with success. If you have more than 120 kg, I don't recommend you this hotel, the shower cabin is a little small. We didn't use any taxi to get to hotel, we arrived by bus, so we took the bus to Piazza Sempione (which is right around the corner) for 1 euro, and usually most of the people can tell you, which buses go in that direction. The bus station is very close, and you can reach the city center easy and fast using tram or bus (tram no. 90 or bus no. 36), which gets you to termini station, from where you can explore the whole city center. I suggest you to buy a weekly bus ticket for 16 euro, that can be used for all bus, tram, metro and train lines of the city, it certainly worth paying for. In the hotel at daytime they have frozen sandwiches, but can order pizza from a close restaurant. We asked the reception for a good restaurant, and they sent us to a fine italian restaurant, the CITTA GIARDINO. The food was OK, but the staff was awfull. If you want to have a pleasant evening, I do not recommed it. Even a fast food is a better solution.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel although maybe a little bit too out of the way for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: gizmo123london
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in a residential area and about a 25 minute tram ride to the city centre. The tram can be caught from around the corner for just one euro. When we booked the hotel it stated that there was a 24 hour restaurant. I'm not too sure if it is still advertised as that but this is certainly not correct! on arriving at the hotel at 9pm we thought we would get a snack so ordered a burger which was a microwaved burger and not very nice at all! We also had breakfast included in the price which we ordered once but did not ask for again for the next couple of mornings. Breakfast consisted of an odd tasting croissant, "toast" which was served in a packet and some yogurt which was the only thing I ate. Apart from the food though the hotel and the room itself was nice, very modern and clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. I would recomment you take advantage of the free shuttle service into town (this needs to be booked in advance). My advice if you are staying for a few nights would be to pay a bit extra if possible and to get somewhere a little bit closer to town. Also, if the hotel offer a transfer from the airport to the hotel for 60 euros, DONT take it! Get a taxi from the station and they will charge you around 40 euro's and it will take half the time to get there, i think he drove us the long way round so that we could get our monies worth! Also, don't take anything from the minibar, they charge about 4 euros per can of drink!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Rome...”
Reviews.Author: HolidayLoverRJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for those with champagne tastes on a beer budget. The hotel is tucked away in a mainly residential area that has great access into the centre of town (where the bus terminal is). There are about 4 buses that will take you directly into town, within 10 minutes. The hotel is clean, simple and modern. The pictures on the website are exactly how the hotel looks. Some of the rooms do seem to be quite small though, if you can try and get a room with a balcony. Perfect for enjoying a late night drink or an early morning breakfast. The breakfast, which was included in the very cheap price was also nice. Only negative was that it was repetetive. We stayed in the hotel for 5 nights and it was the same everyday. Good quality hams, cheeses, breads, jams, cereal etc. With fresh orange, teas and coffees. The dining area was very light, with large windows which was a great way to start the morning. The hotel also has free internet access in the communal area, which comes in handy when planning trips etc for the day if your last minute as I usually am. On the main road, where the bus goes past to get to the hotel, there is a great Pizza place...lots of choices and all fresh. Try to avoid the kebab place on the corner by the hotel though. Great base to visit Rome from. Lots to see and do in Rome, take good walking shoes! Top Tip: Buy a pass for the buses and trains as its the cheapest way to get around Rome. Lots of great places to eat in Rome, but try not to get ripped off in tourist areas where the food is cheap and they lure you in with set menus! The house wine is also a great option!

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel but a fair trek to the centre”
Reviews.Author: DivaDee_8
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed at the hotel on a short break to Rome. The hotel was nice, clean and the staff very help. Even before departing for Rome I contacted the hotel via their website and asked how I could reach them by public transport. I was sent a fairly prompt response back which I was very impressed with. My main concern was that due to the fact I was arriving on a Sunday, their day of rest, i wasn't sure if reaching them woud be easy. I had no problems. I took the Leonardo express train from FCO to Rome Termini Station (A one way ticket costs 11euros) and then took the no. 90 bus (1 euro) to Piazza Sempione. The hotel does offer an airport transfer shuttle service which costs 60euros (luggage cost are included). My only criticism of the hotel is it's location. It is a fair distance out and not close to any train stations. Bus nos. 90 (to termini station), and 60 (takes you to piazza venezia. useful place to get off to see the roman forum and colleseum) are the useful ones to catch. The bus no. 40 will take you from termini station to the vatican. Bus services, especially the no. 90 finish at about 12am, so after that time, taxis would be your only alternative. Another thing to be weary of is that often the bus stop signs are not all that well lit/clear therefore making it hard to see if your getting off at the right place. The hotel does mention on it's website that they offer a free shuttle service to termini station, but for some reason, it wasn't running during the 3 days i was there. Still not sure why. The best thing I found was to buy a one day travelcard which costs around 4 euros and you can buy it at any news kiosk. If you are intending on doing a few museums over several days then a Roma Pass may work out cheaper (20euros) Overall, I would not discount staying here again however, if you are going to Rome for the first time I would probably recommend you stay a little more closer to the centre. At least popping back to the hotel to recharge and escape from the heat would be far easier.

Reviews.Title: “We adored the ARS”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireOlive_oil
Reviews.Content: We can thoroughly recommend the ARS Hotel. The staff are very helpful; the rooms very clean and bright; the continental breakfast was excellent value. Although situated in a quiet residential district 5km from the centre of Rome, there is a frequent express bus service (although crowded at peak times) which gets you to the centre in approx. 20 minutes. The hotel also offer a free bus service to the centre at 9 a.m. which it is advisable to book well in advance. We would have no hesitation in using the ARS in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The ARS was nice”
Reviews.Author: mantonandkylie
Reviews.Content: The ARS is a nice hotel. It looked like it had been recently renovated. Nice shower and bathroom. Bed area was small but fine, clean and tidy. Not too far from town and the people at the front desk were happy to give directions. Good breakfast available and free internet. Good experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Ars Hotel - A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sassyerin
Reviews.Content: We were always excited to come home to our little palace after a long day of site seeing. A totally beautiful hotel, great service, totally clean, modern, sexy and up to date. It felt like home. Marble floors & baths, beautiful big new windows, very spacious for Rome. Bathroom was totally clean & modern - perfect for 1 person at a time with a sliding door - nice to have a bathrm in room. Not too expensive for what you get. The distance wasn't bad at all - I'm use to doing a 20 min bus ride into a city centre anyway, and bus came all the time. The 20 min bus ride was worth it since the hotel was so nice. Beautiful bus route into the city along Nomentana. Area felt safe - unlike other traveller reviews. Breakfast was amazing - really nice sunlit window room with a wide assortment of complimentary breakfast choices. The staff were so kind, they even called our room to see if we needed extra towels etc since we hadn't emerged from the room on a rainy day. We didn't have to call them. It really felt like they cared and took much interest in the guests. The staff recommended and booked us onto a 1 day trip to Pompeii & Naples - a fabulous must do - the staff gave us packed breakfasts and a mini bus picked us up directly at hotel early and dropped us to main bus tour launch point downtown. Internet terminal's were great. My hope is that everyone visiting Rome will discover this gem like we did. We have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brumcentral
Reviews.Content: Stopped here Jan 08, we found it to be clean, comfortable and warm. Staff were helpful, and the hotel was well decorated in a contemporary style. Its a bit far out from central Rome, a Taxi was 15 euros to the centre, so wasn't too bad, but it certainly when we go back we would want to be more central. The breakfast was so so, a bit bland and nothing to write home about, also the mini bar prices were a bit OTT. The shower was also tiny. The internet didn't work in our room, we spent ages trying to get it to work, in the end the receptionist gave us the password for the wifi , which I had to use in the reception area. The reception recommended a local bistro to us, and we had the best meal there in the whole time we were in Rome. It was an ok place as I only paid £40 a night, if I had paid more I might be a little less happy. If you want a base to explore room, and just somewhere to rest your head, its more than adequate, but if you expect pampering, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: MeenaB
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. The location was average, as we had to go to termini to get to the center of the city. Bus 90 had a good frequency, but still was a pain. The bus stop is close to the hotel. Taxi ride from Termini station to hotel costs 10 Euros. We had a early morning flight (7 am) out of FCO. The hotel staff booked a shuttle for us, and costed 55 euros for 2 people. The breakfast was average, and had the usual cereals, croissants, bolied eggs, juices and cofee. There is free internet access in the room, you can borrow the LAN cable from the staff. There are 2 computers also available for checking emails etc in the hotel lobby, which is free too. Overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ars Hotel, Average, not great.”
Reviews.Author: Xavier__Andrea
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, contemporary design, clean. At least the lobby. The room was super small, and for that price, 90£, i think it was way too small. The toilet floor was not super clean as the walls. ANd yes, the fact that it was in the back building, in a maze of stairs, didn't help the overall impression. Mine was a business trip and for once i decided to be closer to the meeting, instead of the more central via veneto where i stayed in the past. Well, i have to say that next time i'll go back to have my taxi trip on the morning and be more central and in a real 4+ star hotel. The staff on the other side was very nice and friendly. Not a common thing in Rome. So plus points on this front. Xavier

Reviews.Title: “really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: heviseeper
Reviews.Content: I had read mixed reviews and was really surprised at how nice it was. We all really enjoyed staying here - clean, tidy, modern, helpful staff and especially we loved the roof terrace in the evenings. The only drawback it is a little way from the city centre but we used buses which are pretty regular. There is also a lack of good restaurants in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cool and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Lona17
Reviews.Content: We liaised with the hotel prior to arrival re taxis, etc and received prompt helpful emails which reassured us about our forthcoming stay. Our taxi was waiting for us on arrival at Ciampino and (despite the notorious Italian driving) we arrived safely within about 25min The hotel was fully air-conditioned while we were there and definitely had a classy feel to it, clean and with fresh flowers dotted around, with polite and efficient staff. The roof terrace was fab to sit with drinks in the evening. We stayed in the annex, with a lift up to the 4th floor. Room was spacious and light, again, it was clean but some stains on the surfaces let it down a bit. Bathroom was small but managed to cram in a separate shower and spa-bath which was a bonus. Hotel recommended a restaurant close by for dinner, it was good, but not exceptional, I preferred heading into the city for dinner the second night for the atmosphere. Breakfast at the hotel was okay, pastries, choice of cereal, sliced meat/cheese, a usual continental, nothing too exciting. It was just a 5min walk to the bus stop into the city centre and about a 30min bus ride, which was probably the most uncomfortable I've endured in a long while! Hot, crowded, airless and standing all the way in, we were with friends so shared a taxi after our initial bus-experience which varied from about 15-20euro one way, which I didn't think was too bad considering the alternative! All in all a pleasant stay, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandStewarts
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel, very Art Deco and well renovated with great attention to detail and an upmarket, classy feel to it.. Good staff, very helpful and attentive. Only problem is location, though this was not a problem for me, it might be for some folk. The hotel is about 20 mins from city centre by bus (which goes every 5 mins.) and the area is a bit run down, though the street the hotel's on is quiet and residential and the area feels pretty safe generally. FANTASTIC breakfast ! You can easily stoke up for the day and not need to eat until dinner time...which I did !! Warning....do NOT touch the mini bar, it's a rip off, and those snacks laid out like freebies are not ! Hotel will give you a card for a nearby restaurant which is pretty good, but I preferred the Menenio Agrippa on Via Nomentana. I found the staff friendlier and less "tourist weary". There are several Pizza places and bars around. All the ones I went to were good. To catch the bus into the city, turn right at the bottom of the road that the hotel's on. Note a news Kiosk at which you can buy tickets (16 E for a week, unlimited travel bus train or metro, or 1E single trip). Get to crossroads , turn right and you'll see the 90 bus stop. If you want to go to Colisseum you can take the 60 by turning left instead of right at the crossroads. Both buses are expresses and run very frequently. Bus stops about 3-4 mins walk from hotel. The hotel gives directions to the hotel involving train, metro and bus. MUCH simpler is to catch a shuttle bus to the main station and catch a no.90 bus. I would not recommend the Metro, particularly with luggage, it's dirty, crowded and feels a bit threatening. Don't take a taxi unless you're desperate, they're very expensive. Note that if you have to dump luggage at any time, there's a left luggage facility on platform 24 at the main station (Termini) Don't let the location of this hotel put you off, it's an easy trip into the city and it can be nice to withdraw from the noise and bustle of the city after a long day trekking around the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: dottorsocrates
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel. Far away from the center but at a real reasonable price for an hotel in Rome. The hotel has parking but does not have a restaurant. We went at the restaurant the hotel suggested "Città Giardino". Food seemed good but the following day I spent the whole morning in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Loads of croissants!!”
Reviews.Author: harpomarx
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying at the Ars Hotel with my boyfriend and we had a really great time. Our taxi was only 50 Euros from the airport to the hotel and we were met with a friendly reception. There is a big bowl of jelly sweets on the Reception desk and they taste really nice. It is modern and clean as described. Our room was quite small and didn't have a bath but we found it suited us fine. You get a shower cap with love hearts so that makes up for it. We were not aware of any noise at all from other guests. Also, the lift always came when we called it. In fact, we would have races to see who could get up to the room quicker - by stairs or lift and I always won in the lift.The area around the hotel is not the most attractive but we felt safe enough and found locals helpful and friendly. The bus into the centre took about 20-30 mins depending on the time of day but is pretty cheap. 4 Euros for a day ticket, 1 euro for a single. We got a taxi home from the centre one evening and this cost about 10 euros. The breakfast was fantastic - in fact my boyfriend ate far too many croissants and ham rolls and boiled eggs and is now on a strict diet. If you don't mind being a bit out of the centre, then go for this place. It has a nice veranda on the roof which would be good to sit on in the summer and sip cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place.”
Reviews.Author: CALuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: PROS: Modern amenities, very comfortable, very clean and new, excellent breakfast, free Internet. CONS: Location--far from downtown Rome--about a 20 minute bussride. However, the busstop is just down the street. Overall, when in Rome you must make a choice: 1) Close to heart of Rome (walking distance), with small, older, overpriced hotels. 2) Just outside of Rome (ARS Hotel--20 minute bussride), affordable, comfortable hotel, great value, boring neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “ARS- Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crazychic_78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last year in the summer. It's a good, clean, cheap hotel. The only large downfall is that it is far from all the sights. There is a bus that takes you into the centre, which takes around 20mins or so. The hotel staff are fantastic and recommended some nice restaraunts to go to in the evenings. If you are only in rome for a few days i would stay closer to the centre and avoid all the time it takes to travel in.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique-style hotel”
Reviews.Author: goodtripper
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for tourists, located in a quiet residential suburb north east of the city centre. I stayed here with my 2 young children, their 2 cousins and aunt in 2 family rooms for 3 nights last weekend and cannot fault our experience in any way. The hotel is relatively small, but having less than 50 rooms, I consider the facilities to have been excellent. Stars are not awarded for size, after all. All staff that I encountered were friendly, efficient and couteous. They were also extremely helpful, providing accurate information on how to travel into the city centre, what to see, where to eat, how to use the buses etc. The hotel is very well sign-posted in the local vicinity but you might be better to take a taxi if arriving after dark in the first instance. Do not expect brocade and chintz. And do not expect to feel that you are in an anonomous chain hotel room that could be anywhere. Instead, expect something that is a little bit different. Quirky even. Something that is bright, airy and stylish. Expect white walls and contemporary art. Barcelona-inspired leather sofas and chairs. Think minimalism and Phillipe Starck and you'll get the general idea. As this is not a purpose built chain hotel, the bedrooms are all different. Our rooms were extremely spacious and comfortable. And without a shadow of doubt, had the most comfortable hotel beds I have slept in anywhere in the world (and I was the one in the sofa-bed!). Our bed linen was changed during our 3 night stay - I've gone a week in 'better hotels' before that's been done. The TV had English language satelite channels. There was a mini bar. The bathroom was not overly large but it was spotlessly clean. As was the room itself. And I hadn't travelled to Rome to sit in the bathroom or in my hotel bedroom anyway. Here's a hint - the blinds in the bedrooms are double blinds, having a secondary total blackout blind behind the less opaque decorative one. I did not notice the noise referred to by others in spite of having windows with dual aspects and my head being effectively the other side of the elevator shaft. The hotel was full, there were families with young babies etc and I heard no noise despite being a light sleeper and insomniac if conditions are not to my liking. Sirens? Didn't hear any around the hotel but it is Rome! Nor did I hear doors slamming or others' footsteps. This hotel does not pretend to be something that it is not. Therefore there is no swanky piano bar. But it is possible to be served drinks in the small area off the reception. And they'll pop a cd in the player for you to create some atmosphere! There is internet access and a computer to use in the lounge. There's a small gym, lift and nice gardens with a seating terrace. It's clean. And it's not expensive. There is no restaurant, catering being limited to the breakfast room on the lower garden level. Breakfast is an unpretentious affair - continental with a perfectly adequate selection of breads, croissants, cereals, fruit, meats and cheese etc. Teas, coffee and fruit juices. No fried bacon and eggs though if that's more your style. For the evening, we were directed to an excellent local restaurant less than 5 mins walk from the hotel. The Città Giardino is very much a locals' place with authentic Itallian cuisine rather than a tourist haunt and we enjoyed it so much we returned there 3 nights in a row. Clearly, we were therefore walking around at night time. I did not feel unsafe at any time walking to or from the hotel to this restaurant. I felt quite comfortable with 4 children under the age of 12 to be on the streets after 11pm and simply cannot understand other references to the area being unsafe. There is some graffiti around. But Rome is covered in the stuff and has been since ancient times (it's an Italian word after all). And like most places, Rome gets dark as the evening progresses! One things for sure - we were walking the streets late and at the weekend. The streets of most British cities and many British towns at that time would be peopled by marauding gangs of drunken youths, frequently with malicious intent. Or staggering bands of scantily clad young women singing bawdy songs loudly and throwing up after one Bacardi Breezer too many. Here, in my experience, you're more likely to encounter someone taking their dog out for a late evening stroll. Much has been said on the subject of this hotel's location. It's not in the centre of Rome - it's in the suburbs. That's what you are paying for. Don't go to this hotel if you want to step outside the front door and be in the midst of it all. But it's easy to get into the centre. There are very frequent express buses from the stops close to the hotel that will take you to either the railway / bus terminus (No 90) where you can pick up the tour buses and subway or to the city centre (No 60). The journey time is around 25-30 mins and will provide you with an authentic Roman experience. Tickets are available from the news kiosk at the bottom of the hill and cost 1 euro. Ask at reception for one of their maps - really good and no need to buy anything else. In summary, this is a good choice if you're looking for something that's slightly different, good value and you don't mind making a relatively short journey by public transport into the city centre. Don't choose it if you want everything on your doorstep, lots of local bars and restaurants, don't like the minimalist look and prefer squidgy sofas and everything under the same roof.

Reviews.Title: “ARS is must SKIP!!!”
Reviews.Author: mr/mr.smith
Reviews.Content: Look I'm the nice guy on the block and I hate giving negative feedback, but this is a must. First thing you notice when arriving at the hotel, which costs 70 Euro by taxi, is that you are by no means in a safe area. My wife and I have been traveling for 2 weeks between Belfast, London, France and now Rome, and this hotel has been the one place we actually have felt unsafe in the area around the hotel. Ok when it comes to the hotel it looks new and shiny, but it is in no way a 4 star hotel. We stayed at a 3 star in Belfast and it was much better than this could ever have been. Our first room was cramp and broken up. It had a small area as you walk in the door that had 2 plastic space age chairs for your most uncomfortable use. Seeing as how I have a business to run while I'm away this was not going to work. The bathroom had only a shower and enough counter space for 1 persons stuff. To add insult it was in the back of the property which required going down 2 flights of stairs and than back up another couple of flights because waiting and waiting for the lift was no use. So we asked to be moved to another room with a desk and maybe a tub this time? Ah the new room, more space, a desk, no A/C!!!! We came to find out that the rooms in the hotel have seasonal climate control, meaning the hotel decides when you get to be hot and when you get to be cold. As one of the previous reviews stated, the noise is ridiculous. Every time a door closes in the hotel you get a loud bang. Not to mention that every person on your floor wearing heels is a marching band. King size bed in the new room was 2 twins pushed together. I'm 6' and the toes were hanging over the edge the whole night. Don't get me wrong this hotel is trying, but they are missing the mark. For first time visitors, stay away. The lousy rooms and noise from doors and shoes along with sirens every 10 minutes make it a rough hotel for relaxing in. My wife and I can in no way give this hotel a good review. Travelers beware.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: JoMcI
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. I had read the mixed reviews on this site before I went and decided to give it a go. We were very pleased with our choice. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful, rooms were spotless and cleaned daily (toiletries and towels supplied) and the breakfast was good. We were well aware that it would be a bus journey out of town but felt it would be worth it to get away from the hustle and bustle having stayed in the city centre on previous visits. The buses are very frequent and easy to use and it takes approx 20-30mins. Its 1euro for 75mins or 4euro for a day ticket so good value. When you get off no 90 or 60 at Sempione (stop is at a big set of traffic lights after bridge), hotel is on the left and up a hill a little bit (signposted). I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel or visit it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value but far from downtown”
Reviews.Author: anitaowl
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel - nice, simple, clean rooms, large bathrooms, beautiful reception area and a large buffet breakfast with made-to-request espresso and capuccino. Great value for the money. The ONLY thing wrong with it is that it's a good 1/2 hour bus ride from the city center of Roma. There is a morning car shuttle at 9:00 a.m., but it that is inconvenient, it's the bus or a pricey taxi.

Reviews.Title: “A journey into the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Suley
Reviews.Content: After checking the reviews and the hotel website the Ars seemed like a great choice to celebrate a friends 30th Birthday in! We found the hotel to be very modern with contemporary furnishings, rooms on the small side and balcony without a view! Service was slow but staff were pleasant enough considering the amount of rude and arrogant Romans we came across but the biggest let down was the location! There is no way in the world that this hotel is only a 15 minute ride from the Termini Station...try an hour by bus and 30 mins by taxi! We were very disappointed with the location as we were misled by the distance to the city centre. We actually booked the room for two nights but because of how unsafe we felt in the area and the lack of amenities i.e places to eat and drink we decided to check out and stay right in the heart of The Spanish Steps where we began to feel 'the real Rome'! If you dont mind trekking into the city centre then this is perfect for you otherwise you may be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Best cup of tea!!”
Reviews.Author: pinkversey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good 15mins from Termini Station but is very accessible by the No.90 Express bus or the number 60. Buses are very regular so getting to and fro was not a problem. The staff were very helpful escpecially Eugene who couldn't be more helpful. The best place to eat near the hotel is Agrippa Meneno. Family run trattoria and the food was just gorgeous and a half litre of wine only €4! You wouldn't get this in the centre of Rome. There is nothing to do around the hotel during the day so you will have to go to the centre of Rome. TIP: Buy a 3 day ticket from the tobacconist at the end of the hill just where the 90 stops and this will allow you unlimited use of buses, subway and train. Make sure you validate the ticket only once when getting on the bus. We went to the Vatican City using our tickets and it worked out a dream. The Hotel is spotless and the breakfast is a lot of breads and cakes (not good if you are wheat intolerant) and fruit. Would highly recommend this hotel. We visited 11/9-18/9 2006. Have a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: nethgirb
Reviews.Content: This is a recently and very nicely remodeled hotel, clean and attractive. The staff spoke mediocre to very good English. We were in two rooms. One was quite small but with a very large balcony. The other felt bigger, though maybe just because the layout was better. Breakfast was decent. The only major problem was that we had booked a shuttle from the airport to our hotel, but they lost the reservation and didn't show up. We ended up taking an expensive cab. However, the person responsible did apologize profusely the next day. Also, the free Internet worked in the first room but not in the second (but there's still the computer in the lobby that anyone can use). Once we figured out how the buses work, it was easy to get to and from Rome: take the express buses, 60 or 90, to/from the city center and Termini station, respectively. There's night service (60N and possibly 90N, don't know) but take note that in the city center the night buses follow slightly different routes.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMSSENA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in ARS between 10-16 September. Our room was very nice, with a balcony ( lucky us!!) ... the bed was superb... As already was told, the breakfast was for us the worst in our stay in ARS. They should improve in the quality and variety. The staff was very friendly, always helping us finding a good solution for our questions. From termini to the hotel take bus nr. 90 ( there are a lot of them)... We went to Florence one day . From termini you can get a train in the morning and return in the evening. Florence was amazing ...Please do visit Rome as also very nice, with a lot of traffic but the transport system works very well.. We hope to come back to Rome and why not to ARS Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hated this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2jayhawks
Reviews.Content: Prior to our trip, I had contacted the Ars hotel to make sure our reservations were ok. The hotel stated they did not have us. I sent them a copy of the booking information and they stated that they would not know until we arrived if our reservations were valid. I was concerned but I had the booking information so I went forward. After numerous attempts to find the hotel, we finally arrive. The hotel is much, much further than we anticipated, actually a 35 minute bus ride from the city center at Tremini train station, plus the directions on the website were wrong and we got lost on the bus system. That is not what the website states how long it would take. The website states that it is only three miles from the city center. So we get to the hotel and get shown to our room, which was unacceptable. It is so small that we could not hardly fit our bags into the room. We had requested a room with a bathtub, so this was not acceptable as this one only had a very small shower. After numerous attempts to relay our displeasure at the room, and get it changed, the hotel was intractable. The hotel staff was very rude and did not even want to help us with directions back into town to see where we were in relation to other sites in the city. We even asked if the next day or Monday if our rooms could be switched and they said it was impossible. We had these rooms, as my understanding, booked well in advance and prepaid, so I was dismayed and disgusted at their reluctance to work with us. The staff had the audacity to tell us not to touch anything in the room until we got things settled. Don't get me wrong, it is a nice hotel, but the service sucks. The room sizes sucks. The staff really suck. If you are a tourist, don't stay here. You'll definately regret staying at such a lousy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic...Great Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: CompleteDonkey
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel was superb, it was clean, fresh and ultra modern, and best of all the air conditioning was a god send! The room itself was a fair size, the beds were extremely comfortable. The shower was small, but the good water pressure made up for it. Breakfast in the hotel wasn’t up to much, then again I'm more your traditional Coco pops kinda girl! If you like continental breakfasts then you will love it. The hotel provided free internet access in every room, and a pc connected to the internet in the lounge room. The staff were very friendly, and very helpful. I recommend that you do not waste you money on buying a street map. I brought a street map and was then given a map by the hotel...I think you can guess which one I used the most! Yes, that’s right, the free one from the hotel. I used it so much that I brought it back home, with holes in it! The one negative point I noticed when I read previous reviews, was the location of the hotel, so I was very wary as to how I would find the hotel once I landed in Rome and how I would get about sightseeing. I was stupid for being so stressed out...it was so simple. DO NOT GET A TAXI! I can guarantee you will be ripped off! I landed in Ciampino airport, once you pick up your luggage if you proceed to the exit you will see a Terravision desk. Terravision works with the airlines to provided transfers to the Termini station. You can pay 8euros for a single trip or you can pay 13.50euros for a return (Very reasonable, since a taxi is 50 euros each way). I recommend a return ticket, then you will not have to worry about trying to get back to the airport. Anyway once we were on the bus, we travelled for 30-35 mins to the Termini station, they dropped us off outside the main entrance (this is also where they will pick you up from on your return). Be very careful here, as several taxi drivers will claim that you booked a taxi DO NOT TAKE A TAXI! Once at the station, you need to purchase bus tickets, you can get this from a newsagents across the street (very cheap- 1 euro for numerous bus trips for 75 mins) once you have your bus ticket, you need to get on the No 90 Express, you won't have to wait long as they are very frequent. Depending on the time of day you use these buses, depends on how cramped you will be, try to avoid rush hours. You will be on the bus for approx 25-30 mins, you will go over 2 bridges and then you need to keep your eyes peeled for the Sempione stop. When you get off this bus, your will see signs for the Ars hotel. However I will give you the instructions as I failed to see the signs! Opposite the bus stop there is a newsstand, you need to walk up this road, where you will pass a petrol station, you will also see a Blockbusters further up the street. There is an opening up this street, which is where you need to go, this will take you up a slight slope and round to the back of the hotel and to the reception. When you return home, you just need to do everything in reverse...couldn't be simpler!!! Getting around Rome using only the buses was a challenge, but it can be done. When deciding what bus to take you will see on the board or several boards which buses will pick up from the stop. You will notice on the boards that there are arrows pointing down, you need to make sure that your destination is after the stop you are at, else you could end up in the sticks! I brought The AA Essential Guide to Rome, this was really good as it told you what buses to catch and what stops to get off at, so I would recommend buying this or something similar (very cheap for £5.99) People told me that Rome was very expensive, but I was pleasantly surprised, in respect of food and sightseeing. I would recommend a guided tour around the Vatican and St. Peters else you will wander around not really knowing what your looking at, we paid 21.50euros for a guided tour around the Vatican museums, well worth the money, the guide was very enthusiastic and well learnt. You can enrol for the tour once inside the museum. We also took a tour of the Colosseum and the Forum for 20 euros, this was worth while also, the tours are readily available around the Colosseum. It would also be a good idea to purchase a book before you go to gain some knowledge of the history of Rome and its sights. You can walk down a road and suddenly come across a building that will take your breath away (corny I know...but true) and you will want to know what it is! Overall my stay at the Ars hotel was superb and Rome itself was amazing. It is a history and a culture that everyone should experience...I hope you enjoy your holiday to Rome as much as I did!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WayneNCalif
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property with my daughter as the first part of our "first time out of the USA" vacation.. Before booking, I read reviews in Trip Advisor.. Check in was flawless, and the room is nice.. Never having stayed outside the US before, we were a little shocked that the room was tiny, but it did not matter ... MARIO checked us in and was EXTREMELY helpful.. He helped us understand the Bus System and we walked down to the stop, less than 5 minutes away..Thank you MARIO ALL you really need from the busses at this Loaction is the 60 Bus that takes you to the Collesium and the 90 that takes you to the Airport.. We also took the Subway twice, which is also very easy.. For 1 Euro per trip on the bus, you cannot beat the price.. Buy a pass if you are here for a time.. Hotel also has Free Internet and a Computer in the Lobby for use.. ANA helped us in the Afternoons, she made us feel like this was our home.. Thank You ANA. and ALEX was also a Big Help... From what we heard from other travellers we met during our visit, this hotel was much better than others.. There is a little Market across the Street, Great FOOD and good variety of snacks and more.. There is a Laundry behind the Hotel.. Owner does not speak English but she was very helpful.. Laundry Service thru the hotel is VERY Expensive.. I will be back in 2007.. I hope that Mario, Ana and Alex are still there

Reviews.Title: “Way better than a budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nyctravelbug
Reviews.Content: ARS hotel is definitely better than a budget hotel. It seems like it has been recently renovated. The furniture and style of the hotel are very modern. The rooms were super clean, the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was great. It is a stand-up shower but that was fine with us. It had good water pressure and they provided nice sized towels I felt as though the staff was very attentive and helpful. I called down for extra pillows and they arrived within minutes. Free internet was available in the room which was a nice perk. Oh, there's an elevator too in case you have large luggage. It's a normal size elevator too. Cereal, rolls, crossiants, danishes, meat and cheese and fruit were available for breakfast. The breakfast was very good and I highly recommend taking advantage of it. It was never so crowded that there were no tables available as a previous review stated. Using the bus to get into town was really simple. Once you come out of the hotel take a right and another right at the main street. You'll pass a Blockbuster and laundromat. Keep going down this street and make a right just after the fruit stand. The bus stop looks like a median in the road on the right side past the fruit stand. This is where you can catch the #60 Express or #90 Express. Both take you into the city and take 15-20 minutes. If you're coming from Termini to the hotel take the #90 bus from Termini to Piazza di Sempione and walk up Monte Altemisso, it's on a hill to ARS. You have to walk around to the back side of the hotel to enter, it's a less than 5 minute walk total from the bus stop. If you take a taxi to the hotel make sure to get tickets before you get on the bus. If you've read anything about Rome though, you know to avoid the taxis, they are outrageous! You can get tickets at the newsstand that's right on that corner. I definitely wouldn't let the fact that you need to take a bus deter you from staying at ARS. It was really easy. In fact, it was nice to stay out of the city and see what it's like outside the city. It was a very pretty and peaceful neighborhood.
