The only downside was that our a/c didn't pump out as much cold air as we'd like. It worked, it just didn't get very cool. Regardless though, we will go back to ARS if we get back to Rome. We will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family, it was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: valeriepaul
Reviews.Content: The hotel was modern, minimilistic and clean. The room was confortable but very small especially the bathroom. One of the downsides of the room I was allocated was that to get to it you had to go up some stairs down another two flights of stairs and then up another set, the stairs are all marble and there are no handrails. Lifts are available but are very small and very slow. The staff were very helpful especially in providing a useful map, pointing out all places of interest and explaining how to use the local bus/metro routes. A one week ticket to use all bus/metro routes cost €16. Breakfast was continental and very limited. The hotel is in a town called Sempione, there are a couple of supermarkets, cash point machine and a pharmacy but you have to travel futher into Rome to find somewhere nice to eat which isn't a problem as public transport runs regularly. The hotel is situated on top of a quite steep hill which after a full day of sightseeing is a bit daunting. Overall I would recommend the hotel as even though it is quite a way from the centre this did not prove to be a great problem and it was well worth the money paid.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JulieAnnV
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel-about 20-30 mins on the bus to the centre but this did not cause a problem. Staff friendly and helpful - gave us good map and advise as to where to catch the bus. Breakfast was simple but plentiful. Rooms were small but clean and nice to come back to after a day in Rome. Not many places to eat within the vacinity of the hotel, but not too much of a problem - found a nice take away and one nice restaurant. Would definately recommend this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladausa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ARS Hotel for 3 nights in July. It is definetely not a 4-star hotel as they claim, but a good solid 3-star. The rooms are small and are very simply furnished, but are reasonably comfortable and clean. When booking, Expedia's description promised free parking, but after arriving we were told that it's an extra 10 euro per day - reasonable for Rome, but still an unpleasant surprise. However, the service is pretty good, and we received help with our luggage (only 2 of our 6 hotels in Italy offered any help). The neighbourhood around the hotel may look a little seedy, but it really is not bad. There's a very nice pizzeria nearby (not the one affiliated with the hotel.... can't remember its name - Hosteria something or other) - just ask at the front desk. The hotel is a bit away from the historical center, but they offer a free shuttle to Termini station every morning (one way - you have to take a cab or a bus back at night - a cab from Termini is around 15 euros, but if you flag one down on the street, it's a bit cheaper with no station surcharge). The breakfast room can get crowded in the morning - you may not find a table to sit down. Also, the free internet station seemed always in use. This is definitely a great budget option for travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading other reviews, and I wasn't disappointed. Getting there is fairly easy, we used the Terravision shuttle, then the No 90 trolley bus, using directions from previous reviewers. The buses are very regular, including Sundays. We arrived about an hour before the 'official' check in time, but this wasn't a problem, as our room was ready. The hotel is very clean, and is in a pleasant residential area. There aren't too many places to eat though, but this wasn't a problem, as we went back into Rome anyway in the evenings. Breakfasts were perfectly adequate, unless you want a fry-up! The hotel was very quiet at night - always a big plus. All in all, much better value than the hotels in central Rome, and I would go there again. Don't be put off by the location - it's not that far out, and part of the fun was travelling into Rome with the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money.”
Reviews.Author: heysnoopy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ARS 5/21 - 5/26 and would return to this hotel if we ever go back to visit Rome again. The hotel is in a nice and quite neighborhood in the suburbs; perfect after a long day of exhaustive sightseeing. Getting to the city center is about a 15 to 20-minute bus ride which we didn't mind. The hotel staff spoke great English and provided us with an excellent map, directions and the buses to take. The hotel is clean, has modern decorative style, and offers great comfortability. The breakfast was really nice and there were varieties to choose from . The only drawbacks, although minor, were that the machines in the gym did not work and the Internet was a bit slow. Overall, the hotel is a good value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading lots of reviews me and the girlfriend decided to give the ARS a go on our trip to Rome. My first impressions of the hotel were great, It was clean, modern and the staff were really helpful and spoke really good english. The continental breakfast was excellent and overall it was a really nice hotel! There were no major drawbacks to the hotel, one slight problem was the location. It took about 10 minutes bus journey into the city centre and to most of the attractions, which didn't bother myself and my girlfriend as the buses were really regular and a bus ticket from the shop was cheap. The bus stop itself was just around the corner as well so if you don't mind getting the bus, its perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice hotel. I landed in Ciampino airport, took a bus for 1 euro to the Ciampino train station (5 mins), there I got on the train to termini (cost 2 euro). Took 15 mins. From Termini I took the bus 90 to the hotel. Took 25 mins. the hotel is a 3 min walk from the bus stop. Simple easy cheap. No problems. Alot of switching and all but thats part of the experience (cost me 3 euros versus and expensive cab). The hotel is in a less than stellar neighborhood but I didnt feel it was dangerous. Everyones different but I could imagine some thinking the neighborhood was not good to be walking around in at night (especially the walk from the bus to the hotel). I typically took a cab home at night from termini which cost me 15 euros. The hotel itself was fantastic. It was bright, clean, great staff, solid free breakfast, very modern look and feel, great security. I would definitely go back there. and it was only 100 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris004
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading generally good reviews on this site. We were not disappointed. The rooms are bright and clean. Breakfast is OK -note there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. The reception staff were helpful - booking restaurants for us, showing us bus routes, booking the airport shuttle etc. The bus ride to the city centre (number 60 express bus) is approx 25mins. To Termini you take number 90 express bus ( a bit shorter) Journey a bit of a pain, but this is made up for by the quiet nights at the hotel. If eating locally, try Hostaria Meneno Agrippa- friendly, english-speaking waitress, good local cooking. (no tourist menus!) Approx 20-25 euros for 2 course meal with wine.

Reviews.Title: “Cant fault it really!”
Reviews.Author: LCFC
Reviews.Content: Hotel is about a 25-35 minute bus ride from Termini(depending on the traffic!) Its obviously a little way out of the City but is in a fairly nice area and the actual hotel is a modern contemplorarly style. We found the staff VERY helpful the actual room was above average(Double bed could have fitted 4...if we were lucky enough!!!!) The Continental breakfast was better than at other hotels we've had BUT get there early as after 9am you will struggle to get a table if the hotel is full. The Breakfast consists of the typical breads,croissants,cakes,yoghurts,meats,cheese,cereal,juices,tea and coffee,so it was quite sufficent. There is a SMALL gym at the hotel BUT if you explore Rome to its potential you should be too tired to exercise!! There are a few places to get things to eat as a take away.One is opposite the road you walk down to the hotel(its got asign of a chicken on).Another is on the corner of the same round and the other is up the hill on that road! One thing to be wary of(and my wife got caught out here!!) is watch the crisps,peanuts and wafers they leave in the room...THEY ARE NOT FREE!! Apart from that and a barking dog at night and the odd traffic noise,if you want somewhere away from the City and are looking for a clean,modern,friendly hotel with not TOO many frills...i'd definetely recommend ARS!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was excellent! excellent room, clean, staff very helpful! - nice area! Avoid Green line tour to Pompei / Naples which the hotel promotes, the drive is very long, and the lunch included in the price is awful! also avoid green line tour around Rome, the hop on hop off service is poor, my wife and I ended up having to get a service bus back to terminii...as the infrequent service left us stranded. Also avoid the restaurant that Ars hotel promotes, it is situated on the opposite side of the square, down a dingey street, the food is awful and service is poor! you will find a better elsewhere, if you walk down the main road back to central Rome!

Reviews.Title: “ok but watch out for hiden costs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the hotel was fine and clean and staff freindly enough. it was claimed in other posts to get to the city centre by bus was only 15 to 20 mins. it was more like 30- 35 mins the bus stop was easy to find from the hotel only take a no 90 its the express bus. the bus jounery it self was awful the public transport in rome is good but buses and metros are always very very crowed and you have to stand and although we never had any problems with pick pickets the over crowed buses and metro's must be a prime targets for pickets so always be alert. also it was good that you get free internet access the use of the computer was useful to check emails etv. but watch out for hide costs as they charge through the roof for drinks from the mini bar and food so dont eat we got charged £80 euros for 10 packets of crisps and 10 chocolate bars and two cans of coke

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ARS hotel for a week after looking carefully through the reviews for hotels in our price range on Trip Advisor. As Rome has a reputation as a noisy city (probably deserved) we wanted to stay out of the centre in a location that was likely to be quiet - which the ARS Hotel certainly was. The hotel is surrounded by quiet private residences, some apartments and some private villas. The hotel was immaculately clean and the room was fairly large with a private balcony. Not that it was warm enough to use it! The breakfast was typical of what you would expect in any western european hotel (i.e. in cities such as Paris) and whilst not massive was easily adequate to fill you up for the day. All the food was fresh and the custard croissants were fantastic (they are the ones covered with icing sugar!) The free internet connection in the lounge was superb for checking the weather. Transport links to the centre are good - Express trolleybus 90 goes every few minutes (in theory) but traffic problems (and highly unionised drivers) mean that the timetable is not really worth the paper its written on. The trolleybus can get massively crowded but here's a tip: If one comes after a bit of a delay and its very crowded stand back and wait. There will generally be another one along in a few minutes (sometimes straight away) and that one will be much quieter. For a quieter but slower route try the 36. All in all, an excellent stay with one possible complaint. The hotel has no carpets and so the sound from a slamming door some way down the corridor can carry a distance. People seemed to be aware of this though and at no point did it affect our sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Even Better than the pictures”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Firstly Id like to say thank you to everyone who wrote a review about this hotel, i based my desicion on the good reveiws it received and boy was I glad I made this desision. Oh, I don't know where to start... Firstly its not difficult to find. so if you're an adventurous person like me and my mum get the bus from the Airport which is just about 1 Euro.Take that to Ananagia... We where there for like three days so the 3 day travel pass that allows you both on the Metro and the bus services which is about 11 Euro From Ananagia take the Metro to Termini (which is like the main central station)and from Termini you can either get the express bus #90 or #60 (90 is a lot faster)it travels on a long straight road, so you're looking about 20 mins on the bus. the stop you're looking for is before the bus starts to bear left I think the stops called (campiaone or something like that)and theres a what looks like a phone booth with a policeman or woman in it, behind that a park. Its really straightfoward so don't be lazy and try their bus services, they're excellent every few minutes. The hotel and staff are goregous ever so freindly, and make you sure dont miss that breakfast theres so much on offer! I loved this hotel and im thinking about going back in August. So if you're looking for a lovely place to stay, id definately recommend this!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jaccott
Reviews.Content: Had four days in Rome. booking ARS Hotel over the internet, so a bit wary. Picked us up from the airport and took us back without any problems at all. Room was a bit small, but very clean and modern with a great seating area. As we spent most of our time in Rome, the size was not a problem. Breakfast was varied and substantial. Staff very friendly and helpful, telling us which buses to catch to various monuments. Although a little way out of the centre of Rome, plenty of buses running from outside and very helpful paper seller to buy tickets from. Best buy was a 3 day bus ticket which is also valid on the metro. Bus takes you directly to the railway station and the bus station. Plenty of tour buses, we chose the Trolley bus where we could get on and off when we wanted to. There were no real restaurants around the hotel, so we ate most evenings in Rome before we went back. If your partner is a fussy eater, like mine, try eating inside the railway station.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, spacious, clean, quiet, and stylish”
Reviews.Author: vanillabeanspeck
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at this hotel. The location is out of the way although a short bus ride from the Stazione Termine will take you almost to its doorstep. The advantage of its location is that there is much less city noise. The other advantage is that you get a lot of bang for your buck compared to staying in a hotel in the city center. The hotel is decorated in a stylish and modern manner and there is Internet access available from a computer in the lobby. The staff spoke fluent English and were helpful in arranging travel and recommending restaurants. The room itself was spacious with a good-sized shower, lots of closet space, a large window facing the garden, and plenty of lighting. The cleaning staff did a thorough job every day and the bathroom toiletries provided were of good quality. The breakfast buffet was fantastic, consisting of a variety of meats, cheeses, pastries, cereal, coffee, juices, cookies, and yogurt; the breakfast room was similarly spacious and clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: tipp2chicago
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here recently and loved it. The rooms were bright and spotlessly clean, and the staff were very friendly. The reccommendation for Hostaria (around the corner) was spot on, and breakfast was pretty good, with croissants, fruit, cereal and yoghurt available. I would reccommend this to anyone, unless you have mobility problems. The bus was very convenient, and I would NOT advise anyone to take a taxi to the hotel. Take the #90 from Termini and use a multi-day pass. If you intend heading to the Colliseum, use the #60 bus as it stops nearby.

HotelInfo.Name: ARS Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Monte Altissimo 20-24, 00141 Rome, Italy
